msghub.i18n.BridgeAlexaShopping.msg.sync: Automatically synchronized shopping list based on the Alexa list "%s".
msghub.i18n.EngageTelegram.command.start: Hi! Try %s to see this message again.
msghub.i18n.IngestStates.rules.threshold:
For '%s', it’s currently {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}}.
I’ll clear this message once it switches to TRUE.

FYI: '%s' reads {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}} right now.
I’ll clear this once it becomes TRUE.

Right now '%s' is {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}}.
As soon as it flips to TRUE, I’ll drop this message.

For '%s', the value is {{m.state-value}} — that’s too high.
Once it’s back to at most {{m.state-max}}, everything is fine again.

'%s' is currently at {{m.state-value}}, which is above the limit.
When it drops back to {{m.state-max}} or less, things are fine again.

Quick heads-up: '%s' is at {{m.state-value}} — that’s higher than it should be.
I’ll clear this once it’s back down to {{m.state-max}} or below.

For '%s', the value is {{m.state-value}} — it’s in the desired range (and right now it shouldn’t be).
Once it drops below {{m.state-min}} or rises above {{m.state-max}}, everything is fine again.

'%s' is currently at {{m.state-value}} — it’s inside the range (and that’s not what we want right now).
I’ll clear this once it goes below {{m.state-min}} or above {{m.state-max}}.

Heads-up: '%s' is sitting at {{m.state-value}} within the range.
This message clears when it leaves the range (below {{m.state-min}} or above {{m.state-max}}).

For '%s', the value is {{m.state-value}} — that’s too low.
Once it’s back to at least {{m.state-min}}, everything is fine again.

'%s' is currently at {{m.state-value}}, which is below the limit.
When it reaches {{m.state-min}} or more, we’re good again.

Heads-up: '%s' dropped to {{m.state-value}}.
I’ll clear this once it climbs back to {{m.state-min}} or higher.

For '%s', the value is {{m.state-value}} — it’s outside the desired range.
Once it’s back between {{m.state-min}} and {{m.state-max}}, everything is fine again.

'%s' is at {{m.state-value}}, which is outside the target range.
When it’s between {{m.state-min}} and {{m.state-max}} again, we’re all good.

FYI: '%s' is currently {{m.state-value}} and out of range.
I’ll clear this once it’s back in the {{m.state-min}}…{{m.state-max}} window.

For '%s', it’s currently {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}}.
I’ll clear this message once it switches to FALSE.

Quick heads-up: '%s' is {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}} right now.
I’ll clear this as soon as it flips to FALSE.

Just so you know, '%s' is currently {{m.state-value|bool:TRUE/FALSE}}.
Once it turns FALSE again, this message goes away.
'%s' boolean condition
'%s' inside the range
'%s' outside the limit
'%s' outside the range
msghub.i18n.IngestStates.startedAt.v5.te: This has been going on since {{t.startAt|datetime}}.
msghub.i18n.NotifyStates.state.blob.labe: full json dump of MsgHub store (interval=%ss)
msghub.i18n.NotifyStates.state.latest.ki: latest notification of kind "%s" for event "%s"
msghub.i18n.NotifyStates.state.latest.le: latest notification of level "%s" for event "%s"
